website_summaries.verdict: This brand offers blends for everything from smaller dogs to senior dogs, all of it cooked in a USA-based organically certified kitchen. Just be sure to check new bags for any tears or cuts.
pros: Food comes in a wide range of options, including blends for small dogs, older dogs, and those with weight problems
Cooked in an organically certified USA kitchen
Good quality food that most dogs love
Bag has a Velcro tab for freshness
cons: This option is a bit on the expensive side, with some buyers noting how the bags keep getting smaller while the price keeps going up

customer_reviews.title: owned by Purina !!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had found a good food only to find out after I purchased this that Purina owns this company. I refuse to buy any Purina products so I wont be buying this anymore
customer_reviews.author: bostons

customer_reviews.title: yes i eat this stuff
customer_reviews.text: i go by this rule, dont feed your dog anything you wouldnt eat. we both like this and im not sure if buddy is getting tired of eating this but i sure dont mind snacking down on this stuff everyday. ive lost 50lbs aleady and im still shaving more fat. this dog food diet is really great and this organic grain chicken just makes it even better! hell yea brother!
customer_reviews.author: Kris A.

customer_reviews.title: We got our pup on this food before they transitioned ...
customer_reviews.text: We got our pup on this food before they transitioned to the smaller bags. Honestly, our dog loves the food and his stools have never been more solid, however $70+ for a measly 18lb bag of food is a huge slap in the face as a customer. I can understand a slight price increase for it being organic, but jumping from a 25lb bag ($50) to a 18lb bag ($70+) is just ridiculous. We will be looking for other options in the near future if the price does not come down on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimate Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Dogs won’t eat it anymore.  Ingredients likely changed.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs used to love this food now they won’t touch it. The recipe has clearly changed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Real Organic Dog Food -- Expensive, But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Since we only eat organic food ourselves, we had grown increasingly uncomfortable feeding our dogs regular dog food ... even the high-quality brands are still made from food sources that are bathed in pesticides and other chemicals. And the niche dog food brands that say they are "human grade"? Well, that really doesn't mean much if it's not organic, because so much of our conventional human food is awash in chemicals and antibiotics. So we finally switched to the Organix line of dry and canned food (which we supplement with cooked grass-fed beef and our own chickens). Yes, it's really expensive, but we feel much better about feeding our dogs organically. It's just so much healthier for them.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product because it’s organic and was looking to switch to a dog food with grains, but our two dogs got incredibly sick from this food. We had to throw out more than half of the bag...Our vet did many tests and the only conclusion was their new diet. After we stopped feeding them this food they drastically improved.
customer_reviews.author: Tim + Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great organic food
customer_reviews.text: I switched my dog to an organic diet two years ago and discovered this brand. She looks great and have no issues with it. I have however heard that Purina bought Castor and Pollux so I’m crossing my fingers they don’t mess with the ingredients. I’ve also tried the wet food which is just as good as this dry. It’s hard to find a good organic food.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Have used it for years.
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my dogs this food for several years. The dogs are healthy. Coats have a great sheen. I had been giving my dogs vitamins as well. But, I was told that with such a high quality dog food, supplements not needed Wish it came in 25 or 30 lb bags for my 6 dogs
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Good food, but pretty pricey.  And then they raised the price!  Lost a customer here.
customer_reviews.text: Started buying in Summer 2019. Good food. We did get a bag with ANTS in it once, probably because none of the bags we've ever received were air tight. Then in December 2019, from one order to the next (less than 1 month), the price was raised 21%. There are other good quality products out there, so we are leaving this brand based on the price change.
customer_reviews.author: boneah

customer_reviews.title: Gained 6 lbs in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I don't doubt the food is high quality, and since my wife and I are trying to eat organic as much as possible I felt the dog should too. This food might be great for a thin dog, but our 7 year old terrier went from 22 lbs to 28 lbs in just 3 months. We were feeding the same amount as we were the prior food. May not be the food, but that was basically the only change. I didn't look to see how the calories compared between foods.
customer_reviews.author: reluctant consumer

customer_reviews.title: My babies really seemed to love this. First of all
customer_reviews.text: My babies really seemed to love this. First of all, its organic so I feel better. Second, its a darker color than the other Organix products. Tried chicken & potato, lamb & rice and salmon & something. Anyway, they really seemed to love this one most of all, regardless of if I added wet Orgainix dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: D best dry food in high protein & organic
customer_reviews.text: I was feeding fresh food to my puppy of 8 months miniature schnauzer & duw the covid19 was not more available so a friend of mine recommended this dry food & wow, my doggie love it & the transmission was smooth from last bag of fresh food. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: chronicles of Leonidas

customer_reviews.title: Chicken meal
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to see this product has chicken meal. It does not clarify what that includes. To me it is filler and I am not willing to continue to pay a premium price for a product that has ingredients that I am not confident in.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Bloser

customer_reviews.title: The Very Best for The Very Beat
customer_reviews.text: Worth the extra expense, for top of the line for a beloved best friend. Archie agrees, and his bowl is not left full for long.
customer_reviews.author: WKE

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food
customer_reviews.text: I have a five year old pitbull that is a very fussy eater and sometimes breaks out from some of the different foods we tried. This is the first dry dog food that she eats and has never had any problems with.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer - Rich

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Food We Have Tried
customer_reviews.text: We have had all of our dogs on this foods for over a year now. I wanted something with "cleaner" ingredients to help them stay as healthy as possible. They all love this food, and especially this particular flavor. It's expensive but the trade-off for their healthiness is worth it for us.
customer_reviews.author: CMont

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what it’s worth
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fact that my dogs loved it! But 50 something dollars for only 10lbs is EXPENSIVE! I thought I’d try it out but it’s not THAT great. I get that it’s organic and everything but I’ve seen some brands for far less with the same ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Our little puppy loves these and we use them as an in-between meal snack and treat, as well as supplemental to his regular food. Our Chihuahua/Jack Russell deserves organic food that he enjoys and these certainly fit the bill.

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: The price is awful, but the food is fabulous. It's the only food we've found that our dog does well with, meaning it doesn't upset her stomach and she has one bowl movement a day as compared to 3 or more with other foods. Love the project, just wish it wasn't so expensive

customer_reviews.title: Every evidence was this was great, except my lab hates it!

customer_reviews.title: My Husky loves this!

customer_reviews.title: dog preferred

customer_reviews.title: The only food I trust, and will feed my ...
customer_reviews.text: The only food I trust, and will feed my dogs, cats, and all of my animals, for many years! The quality is untouchable. I have looked, believe me. It is well worth the extra dollars. Our beloved animals should always eat organic. Fast next day shipping!

product_meta.title: Castor & Pollux ORGANIX Dry Dog Food
product_meta.description: Style:With Healthy Grains| Flavor Name:Chicken & Oatmeal| Size:10 LBCastor & Pollux ORGANIX Organic Chicken & Oatmeal Recipe is a natural dry food made with responsibly raised, organic free-range chicken as the #1 ingredient. ORGANIX dog food is USDA certified organic, so you can trust that it contains no artificial preservatives, flavors or colors, and it's made without corn, wheat or soy. This delicious and nutritious natural dog food contains a superfood blend that includes organic flaxseed, organic blueberries and organic coconut oil for the natural antioxidants your dog needs. This recipe is also made with healthy grains like organic oatmeal and organic barley to help support healthy digestion for your dog. All the fruits and vegetables used in this organic dry dog food recipe are grown responsibly without synthetic fertilizers or chemical pesticides. This wholesome, organic chicken and oatmeal dog food is cooked with love in an organically certified USA kitchen for a taste your dog will love.
feature_bullets: USDA organic certified chicken dog food that contains no artificial preservatives, flavors or colors
Nutrient packed with a blend of superfoods, including organic flaxseed, organic blueberries and organic coconut oil
Dog food with grain contains organic oatmeal and organic barley to help support healthy digestion
This organic dog food is corn, wheat and soy free and contains no artificial colors, flavors or preservatives
One (1) 10.0 lb Bag - Castor & Pollux ORGANIX Organic Chicken & Oatmeal Recipe Dry Dog Food
